climbs.name: Silver Queen
climbs.fa: L. Hadfield, D. Jensen, J. Jones, 1994

content.description:
Climb

Grave Line

or

Slip...Not!

first to gain a fairly large ledge with a 2 bolt anchor. If memory serves me correctly, the 2 bolt anchor that is above

Slip...Not!

is the one we belayed from. If you climb

Grave Line

, you just need to do a short easy traverse over to the other anchors.

From the anchor, head straight up past 6 bolts (cold shuts) to another comfortable 2 bolt anchor. For me, the crux was a mantle between the 5th and 6th bolt. Do a single rope rappel back to previous ledge or continue up

Heinous Cling

(11d), which I have never done. Enjoy!

content.location:
Independence (10b) starts atop Boulder Wall and climbs Iron Stone

(use the same start ledge as for

Silver Queen

(10b))

. Begin 2' left of

Chemical Dependence

(11a)

on the far right side of the ledge. This ledge has multiple access options. A quick access from the ground is

The Ramp (5.7)

crack, to the right of

Livin' On The Edge

(12a) on Boulder Wall. In doing

The Ramp (5.7)

, a climber can reach the anchors atop Independence while easily belayed from the ground. It is 140' from the ground to the anchors.

content.description:
This is the third pitch off the ground. Approaches vary, you can either climb "

Grave Line

" (9+) or "

Slip...Not!

"(10d) to gain a ledge and then walk right on ramp to "

Silver Queen

" (10a). Send "

Silver Queen

", and bring your partner up to the nice ledge with 2-bolt anchor. "Heinous Cling" climbs straight up from this ledge on excellent rock through two roofs to gain easier climbing on the beautiful headwall above.

This route is listed under the Boulder Wall subheading for Monitor Pass in the

"Rock Climbing Colorado"

guidebook by Stuart Green, but I have included it here to keep with the current subheadings on MP.  Rap with two ropes or a single 80m back to the top anchors and ledge on "

Silver Queen

".
content.location:
It is directly above

Silver Queen

.

content.description:
Starting from the ledge atop Boulder Wall on its farthest right side, 9 bolts off the of the ledge give good protection and lead through steep, mind bending, thin face climbing that often leads to chemical dependence, resulting in a two bolt fixed anchor next to a small tree, 80' .

Rappel 140' to ground or keep climbing up. Directly above is

Fearless(11c)

which tops out on the party ledge of Trooper T. or easily move to the Heinous Ledge, move left on the ledge, walk past the top anchor of

Independence

(10b) arriving at the start of

Heinous Cling

(11c

).

H.C

is easily recognized by the black streak through the small, arched roof.
